definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: The profile of the old warrior was characterized by a strong jaw and an aquiline nose.
sentences.chinese: 老战士侧面像的特征是一个坚硬的下巴和一个鹰钩鼻。

sentences.chinese: 其中一个就是已经说过的，通过侧面的通量为。

sentences.english: Pasterns are short and strong and slightly sloping when viewed from the side .

sentences.english: At this point you must alternate lateral and radial truing . Be patient.
sentences.chinese: 在这点上你必须交替的从侧面和纵向进行调整。

sentences.english: E. If the enclosing sides adjoin each other, the area should be properly vented.
sentences.chinese: 如果封闭的侧面彼此邻接，该区域要有适当的通风。

sentences.english: Button on the side of the plane or edge for a smooth transition for the arc-shaped.

sentences.english: But the corners are slower here and there are only small lateral forces.
sentences.chinese: 但是这里的弯角更慢，侧面只有很小的力。

sentences.english: Also, stitch the edge of the window screen which is between the lower circle and the flank of the cone.
sentences.chinese: 同样，缝住底下的那个圈和圆锥侧面的纱窗边缘。

sentences.english: This photo gallery illustrates various aspects of the vaccination campaign.
sentences.chinese: 本组照片说明了疫苗接种运动的不同侧面。

sentences.english: He was standing almost broadside , his great head up and turned toward them.
sentences.chinese: 它几乎侧面站着，巨大的头昂起，转向他们。

sentences.english: The Book of Changes shows people its ideal of personality structure in different sides.
sentences.chinese: 《周易》从不同侧面展示了其人格结构的理想。

sentences.english: Low spreading angles of the turbulent jet restrict the lateral dispersion of sediment particles.
sentences.chinese: 乱流小地分布规模限制啦沉淀粒子在侧面地分布。

sentences.english: The trail emerged from the woods and he looked up at the side of a rocky hill.

definition: line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
reverse side/backside/the other side (of a problem etc)/negative/bad
the back/the reverse side/the wrong side
to come and see/to see a topic from a certain point of view
